name: Agarista revolutissima
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.583.1.8 Etymology: name from the word 'revolutus', which means turned backwards, combined with the suffix '-issima', a superlative that denotes superior quality to the adjective, expressing the leaf characteristics that differentiates this species from others in the genus.

name: Andromeda revoluta
typeLocations: lectotype B;isotype BM;isotype BR;isotype E;isotype G;isotype K;isotype L;isotype M;isotype P;isotype W;isotype F;isotype GH
distribution: Restinga de Cabo Frio, Rio de Janeiro (Brazil, Southern America)

name: Leucothoë duckei
reference: Bull. Soc. Bot. Genève ser. 2, 1: 246, fig. 1909
